relation: Its a community college so you save a significant amount of money and get the same general education as a top 10 school.
Meet people and go somewhere. Nearby there are theaters, malls, whirly ball, mini golf, and large cities.
Their food is actually pretty good and they have a good student ran restaurant.
Dorms arent needed for people that live here.
same as a top 10 school for general eds at a much lower cost.
if you arent sure what you want to do or where you wanna go or you just want to save the money then go here!
As a school it isnt huge or overwhelming. It offers a lot of options to get involved. You cant beat the cost.

textAfterTable: Academic Rigor Some of the best teachers are here in Grayslake, they always have office hours on the syllabus, as well as outside their office. All professors are mandatory to have office hours, and most go beyond to try and make time for your schedule. A lot of professors take attendance to get you ready for your future university. Tips for prospective students If you know your 4-yr school make sure you go off their requirements and not so much CLC's. The problem most students have is that their credits transfer however they don't fit in to the curriculum of their proceeding college. The credits then become electives instead of going towards their degree. Another important rule of thumb is going to class and communicating with professors. Now that you're out of high school some teachers don't make attendance mandatory, however if you don't show up, you will miss out on a lot, and usually there is no make-up. In three sentences CLC has some of the best teachers a community college has to offer, and they get you ready for your four year schooling with attendance and participation. It is great value, but make sure you take the classes you need, because counselors don't always guide you to the right classes unless you know the college you are further attending. A
